summary: The bill, titled the Protecting Americans’ Retirement Savings Act (PARSA), amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to prohibit retirement plan investments in foreign adversary and sanctioned entities. It defines "covered entities" and mandates additional disclosures for employee retirement funds, including reporting of existing investments in such entities. The bill also specifies conditions under which current and contractually obligated investments may continue. The Secretary is required to issue regulations, effective within one year of enactment. The bill directly addresses financial investments.
